snippet: LEAD: The conjunction of state finance problems and Republican fiscal orthodoxy have all but eliminated whatever chance remained that Gov. George Deukmejian of California would be chosen as the Republican Vice-Presidential candidate, and they have...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: The conjunction of state finance problems and Republican fiscal orthodoxy have all but eliminated whatever chance remained that Gov. George Deukmejian of California would be chosen as the Republican Vice-Presidential candidate, and they have perhaps hurt the party's chances of carrying the state this fall.

headline.main: Of Deukmejian's Demise And the Party's Fall Peril

byline.original: By R. W. APPLE Jr., Special to the New York Times
